channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: FigCaps-HF: A Figure-to-Caption Generative Framework and Benchmark with Human Feedback
item.description: Captions are crucial for understanding scientific visualizations and documents.

item.title: Differentially Flat Learning-based Model Predictive Control Using a Stability, State, and Input Constraining Safety Filter
item.description: This safety filter is then used to refine inputs from a flat model predictive controller to perform constrained nonlinear learning-based optimal control through two successive convex optimizations.

item.title: Spinal nerve segmentation method and dataset construction in endoscopic surgical scenarios
item.description: Endoscopic surgery is currently an important treatment method in the field of spinal surgery and avoiding damage to the spinal nerves through video guidance is a key challenge.

item.title: HyperReenact: One-Shot Reenactment via Jointly Learning to Refine and Retarget Faces
item.description: In this paper, we present our method for neural face reenactment, called HyperReenact, that aims to generate realistic talking head images of a source identity, driven by a target facial pose.

item.title: TwinLiteNet: An Efficient and Lightweight Model for Driveable Area and Lane Segmentation in Self-Driving Cars
item.description: Driveable Area Segmentation and Lane Detection are particularly important for safe and efficient navigation on the road.

item.title: BlendFace: Re-designing Identity Encoders for Face-Swapping
item.description: The great advancements of generative adversarial networks and face recognition models in computer vision have made it possible to swap identities on images from single sources.

item.title: CNOS: A Strong Baseline for CAD-based Novel Object Segmentation
item.description: We propose a simple three-stage approach to segment unseen objects in RGB images using their CAD models.

item.title: Event Blob Tracking: An Asynchronous Real-Time Algorithm
item.description: Event-based cameras have become increasingly popular for tracking fast-moving objects due to their high temporal resolution, low latency, and high dynamic range.

item.title: AlignDet: Aligning Pre-training and Fine-tuning in Object Detection
item.description: To this end, we propose AlignDet, a unified pre-training framework that can be adapted to various existing detectors to alleviate the discrepancies.

item.title: Breadcrumbs to the Goal: Goal-Conditioned Exploration from Human-in-the-Loop Feedback
item.description: This procedure can leverage noisy, asynchronous human feedback to learn policies with no hand-crafted reward design or exploration bonuses.

item.title: Kick Back & Relax: Learning to Reconstruct the World by Watching SlowTV
item.description: Unfortunately, existing approaches limit themselves to the automotive domain, resulting in models incapable of generalizing to complex environments such as natural or indoor settings.

item.title: Global Precipitation Nowcasting of Integrated Multi-satellitE Retrievals for GPM: A U-Net Convolutional LSTM Architecture
item.description: This paper presents a deep learning architecture for nowcasting of precipitation almost globally every 30 min with a 4-hour lead time.

item.title: Metric3D: Towards Zero-shot Metric 3D Prediction from A Single Image
item.description: State-of-the-art (SOTA) monocular metric depth estimation methods can only handle a single camera model and are unable to perform mixed-data training due to the metric ambiguity.

item.title: Deep Spiking-UNet for Image Processing
item.description: Furthermore, we adopt a flow-based training method to fine-tune the converted models, reducing time steps while preserving performance.

item.title: BoxDiff: Text-to-Image Synthesis with Training-Free Box-Constrained Diffusion
item.description: As such paired data is time-consuming and labor-intensive to acquire and restricted to a closed set, this potentially becomes the bottleneck for applications in an open world.

item.title: Differences Between Hard and Noisy-labeled Samples: An Empirical Study
item.description: We study various data partitioning methods in the presence of label noise and observe that filtering out noisy samples from hard samples with this proposed metric results in the best datasets as evidenced by the high test accuracy achieved after models are trained on the filtered datasets.

item.title: PE-YOLO: Pyramid Enhancement Network for Dark Object Detection
item.description: Current object detection models have achieved good results on many benchmark datasets, detecting objects in dark conditions remains a large challenge.

item.title: Reverse Knowledge Distillation: Training a Large Model using a Small One for Retinal Image Matching on Limited Data
item.description: We propose a novel approach based on reverse knowledge distillation to train large models with limited data while preventing overfitting.

item.title: GLSFormer : Gated - Long, Short Sequence Transformer for Step Recognition in Surgical Videos
item.description: These results validate the suitability of our proposed approach for automated surgical step recognition.

item.title: Heterogeneous Federated Learning: State-of-the-art and Research Challenges
item.description: Therefore, a systematic survey on this topic about the research challenges and state-of-the-art is essential.

item.title: Neuron Sensitivity Guided Test Case Selection for Deep Learning Testing
item.description: To address the above-mentioned problem, we propose NSS, Neuron Sensitivity guided test case Selection, which can reduce the labeling time by selecting valuable test cases from unlabeled datasets.

item.title: L-Eval: Instituting Standardized Evaluation for Long Context Language Models
item.description: Recently, there has been growing interest in extending the context length of instruction-following models in order to effectively process single-turn long input (e. g. summarizing a paper) and conversations with more extensive histories.

item.title: TREA: Tree-Structure Reasoning Schema for Conversational Recommendation
item.description: TREA constructs a multi-hierarchical scalable tree as the reasoning structure to clarify the causal relationships between mentioned entities, and fully utilizes historical conversations to generate more reasonable and suitable responses for recommended results.

item.title: Amortized Variational Inference: When and Why?
item.description: In this paper, we study A-VI as a general alternative to F-VI for approximate posterior inference.

item.title: EMQ: Evolving Training-free Proxies for Automated Mixed Precision Quantization
item.description: In particular, we devise an elaborate search space involving the existing proxies and perform an evolution search to discover the best correlated MQ proxy.

item.title: Lighting up NeRF via Unsupervised Decomposition and Enhancement
item.description: Neural Radiance Field (NeRF) is a promising approach for synthesizing novel views, given a set of images and the corresponding camera poses of a scene.

item.title: Air Traffic Controller Workload Level Prediction using Conformalized Dynamical Graph Learning
item.description: Air traffic control (ATC) is a safety-critical service system that demands constant attention from ground air traffic controllers (ATCos) to maintain daily aviation operations.

item.title: MSQNet: Actor-agnostic Action Recognition with Multi-modal Query
item.description: Existing action recognition methods are typically actor-specific due to the intrinsic topological and apparent differences among the actors.

item.title: Decoding the Enigma: Benchmarking Humans and AIs on the Many Facets of Working Memory
item.description: Here, we introduce a comprehensive Working Memory (WorM) benchmark dataset for this purpose.

item.title: FLASK: Fine-grained Language Model Evaluation based on Alignment Skill Sets
item.description: In this paper, we introduce FLASK (Fine-grained Language Model Evaluation based on Alignment SKill Sets), a fine-grained evaluation protocol that can be used for both model-based and human-based evaluation which decomposes coarse-level scoring to an instance-wise skill set-level.

item.title: Learned Thresholds Token Merging and Pruning for Vision Transformers
item.description: Vision transformers have demonstrated remarkable success in a wide range of computer vision tasks over the last years.

item.title: EdgeAL: An Edge Estimation Based Active Learning Approach for OCT Segmentation
item.description: However, selecting data for annotation remains a challenging problem due to the limited information available on unseen data.

item.title: Exploring the Landscape of Natural Language Processing Research
item.description: As an efficient approach to understand, generate, and process natural language texts, research in natural language processing (NLP) has exhibited a rapid spread and wide adoption in recent years.

item.title: Behavioral Analysis of Vision-and-Language Navigation Agents
item.description: To be successful, Vision-and-Language Navigation (VLN) agents must be able to ground instructions to actions based on their surroundings.

item.title: Data-Driven Latency Probability Prediction for Wireless Networks: Focusing on Tail Probabilities
item.description: With the emergence of new application areas, such as cyber-physical systems and human-in-the-loop applications, there is a need to guarantee a certain level of end-to-end network latency with extremely high reliability, e. g., 99. 999%.

item.title: Fractional Denoising for 3D Molecular Pre-training
item.description: Theoretically, the objective is equivalent to learning the force field, which is revealed helpful for downstream tasks.

item.title: Long-Tail Theory under Gaussian Mixtures
item.description: We suggest a simple Gaussian mixture model for data generation that complies with Feldman's long tail theory (2020).

item.title: The Role of Entropy and Reconstruction in Multi-View Self-Supervised Learning
item.description: We consider a different lower bound on the MI consisting of an entropy and a reconstruction term (ER), and analyze the main MVSSL families through its lens.

item.title: Investigating the Factual Knowledge Boundary of Large Language Models with Retrieval Augmentation
item.description: In this study, we present an initial analysis of the factual knowledge boundaries of LLMs and how retrieval augmentation affects LLMs on open-domain QA.

item.title: FedSoup: Improving Generalization and Personalization in Federated Learning via Selective Model Interpolation
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel federated model soup method (i. e., selective interpolation of model parameters) to optimize the trade-off between local and global performance.

item.title: Generative Language Models on Nucleotide Sequences of Human Genes
item.description: This decision did not change the problem structure a lot due to the fact that both DNA and genes can be seen as 1D sequences consisting of four different nucleotides without losing much information and making too much simplification.

item.title: Interactive Segmentation for Diverse Gesture Types Without Context
item.description: Interactive segmentation entails a human marking an image to guide how a model either creates or edits a segmentation.

item.title: Learning Discriminative Visual-Text Representation for Polyp Re-Identification
item.description: Colonoscopic Polyp Re-Identification aims to match a specific polyp in a large gallery with different cameras and views, which plays a key role for the prevention and treatment of colorectal cancer in the computer-aided diagnosis.

item.title: GenKL: An Iterative Framework for Resolving Label Ambiguity and Label Non-conformity in Web Images Via a New Generalized KL Divergence
item.description: To tackle the limitation of entropy maximization, we propose $(\alpha, \beta)$-generalized KL divergence, $\mathcal{D}_{\text{KL}}^{\alpha, \beta}(p\|q)$, which can be used to identify significantly more NC instances.

item.title: PyTAG: Challenges and Opportunities for Reinforcement Learning in Tabletop Games
item.description: To bridge this gap, we introduce PyTAG, a Python API for interacting with the Tabletop Games framework (TAG).

item.title: RaTE: a Reproducible automatic Taxonomy Evaluation by Filling the Gap
item.description: Taxonomies are an essential knowledge representation, yet most studies on automatic taxonomy construction (ATC) resort to manual evaluation to score proposed algorithms.

item.title: Multi-Grained Multimodal Interaction Network for Entity Linking
item.description: Then, to derive the similarity matching score for each mention-entity pair, we device three interaction units to comprehensively explore the intra-modal interaction and inter-modal fusion among features of entities and mentions.

item.title: From West to East: Who can understand the music of the others better?
item.description: This leads to research questions on whether these models can be used to learn representations for different music cultures and styles, or whether we can build similar music audio embedding models trained on data from different cultures or styles.

item.title: Confidence Estimation Using Unlabeled Data
item.description: We stipulate that even with limited training labels, we can still reasonably approximate the confidence of model on unlabeled samples by inspecting the prediction consistency through the training process.

item.title: ProtiGeno: a prokaryotic short gene finder using protein language models
item.description: Prokaryotic gene prediction plays an important role in understanding the biology of organisms and their function with applications in medicine and biotechnology.
